intro: Stipa calchaquia, commonly known as the redgrass or red needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and distinctive red or purple tints in its foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny florets, typical of many grass species. Stipa calchaquia is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that allow it to thrive in poor soils and extreme temperatures. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
